Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a dog. Sothic dog, ears erect above the face with curly tail. The face is elongated towards the muzzle. Wearing a collar with a bell shaped pendant bulla. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating and red paint. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.195) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4581 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
